intro: Crepis runcinata subsp. hallii, commonly known as the Hall's goat's beard, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flower heads that are surrounded by bracts, typical of the dandelion family. It thrives in rocky and dry environments, often found in alpine meadows. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
